Vector
 <math alttext="open angle brackets 1 half comma 1 half close angle brackets"><mfenced close=">" open="<"><mrow><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced></math>
 <math alttext="open angle brackets fraction numerator square root of 3 over denominator 2 end fraction comma 1 half close angle brackets"><mfenced close=">" open="<"><mrow><mfrac><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced></math>
 <math alttext="open angle brackets 1 comma 1 close angle brackets"><mfenced close=">" open="<"><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>
 <math alttext="open angle brackets 0 comma 2 close angle brackets"><mfenced close=">" open="<"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>

The table defines vectors <math alttext="vector k"><mover><mi>k</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>, <math alttext="vector m"><mover><mi>m</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>, <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>, and <math alttext="vector w"><mover><mi>w</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>. Which of these four vectors is a unit vector?

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
